metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0929 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In ion_dma_buf_end_cpu_access and related functions of ion.c, there is a possible way to corrupt memory due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-187527909References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: alexmurray> This vulnerability is within the Ion memory allocator. This code is only present, BUT not enabled, in a limited number of Ubuntu kernels. As such no Ubuntu kernels are affected by this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
